question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Static: RAYON_EXEC_POOL] [Thread pool exhaustion] Can malicious transactions cause the rayon thread pool to be exhausted, preventing new blocks from being executed and causing loss of liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Static: RAYON_EXEC_POOL] [Thread count manipulation] Can the num_cpus::get() value be manipulated in containerized environments to create an insufficient thread pool? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Static: RAYON_EXEC_POOL] [Unwrap panic] Can the rayon ThreadPoolBuilder::build() fail and cause an unwrap panic during initialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Static: RAYON_EXEC_POOL] [Thread naming collision] Can thread naming conflicts cause issues in monitoring or debugging during parallel execution? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Speculative log corruption] Can init_speculative_logs be called concurrently by multiple threads, causing log corruption or race conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [StateViewId bypass] Can transactions bypass speculation by setting StateViewId::Miscellaneous, allowing non-deterministic execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Concurrency level manipulation] Can BlockExecutorConfig.local.concurrency_level be set to extreme values (0 or very large) to cause DoS or resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Module cache poisoning] Can malicious transactions corrupt the module_cache_manager during try_lock, causing subsequent blocks to use poisoned cache? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Module cache lock contention] Can the try_lock on module_cache_manager fail and return VMStatus error, but still leave the cache in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [BlockExecutor construction timing] Can the BlockExecutor be constructed with stale config or state_view during epoch transitions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Execute block race] Can execute_block be called on multiple threads simultaneously with the same state_view, causing non-deterministic results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Transaction output ordering] Can the order of transaction_outputs in the returned BlockOutput differ from the input order due to parallel execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Partition point calculation] Can the partition_point calculation for retry status be manipulated to flush incorrect speculative logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Speculative log flush race] Can flush_speculative_logs be called concurrently during different block executions, causing log corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block_on_thread_pool()] [Block epilogue manipulation] Can malicious validators manipulate the block_epilogue_txn to bypass validation or alter block rewards? (Critical)
